channel.title: Renting out a Server Machine
channel.description:
Renting out a Server Machine.
I am renting out a Server Machine which is assigned to port 82(apache can still be accessed from port 80)/23(ftp)/3308(mysql)
What you get: 32GB Hard disk space Full MYSQL server Full APACHE Full PHP Full FTP Access Full Support 99.99% Uptime Unlimited Transfer Unlimited Email addresses Windows Server Full remote connection (tightVNC) Faster connection All this for only $27 a month! ($10 base + $1 a KG) Email/MSN me at: admin@doognotna.co.nz for all the information.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------- (C)NotNaTek 2008

item.title: Renting out a Server Machine

@The_Un-Named wrote:

Jme is correct. No selling/renting.

item.title: Renting out a Server Machine
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“runescape3dude, post:25, topic:201811”][quote author=jme link=topic=266465.msg2202854#msg2202854 date=1209003297]
Are we forgetting that selling anything (except scar scripts) on these forums are against the rules? Don’t know if this counts or not.

Apart from that, I wouldn’t trust you as a host. Maybe if you acted professional, and demonstrated some knowledge on maintaining a server than you might have a chance of someone actually buying. I mean, you don’t even seem to understand the difference between VPS and a dedicated server.

[/quote]

What have I done to you in order for me to recieve such a shit response?[/quote]

Be a complete retard?

Also if you would take a moment to read the rules,

Rule 10: We do not sell anything on this site with the exception of SCAR scripts. SCAR Scripts must be verified, check the script sales board for more info.

Read full topic

Well I just called it a VPS then… The person gets the entire server… Yes I am charging for the wieght of the server. Parts are heavy, and the heavier it is, the stronger the rack you need.
[/quote]

Oh lord, get out please. We don’t need any more noobs in this industry.[/quote]

item.title: Renting out a Server Machine
item.dc:creator: @Tree Tree
item.description:
@Tree wrote:

In Regards to Runescape3dude’s posts:

You constantly insult the staff members and blame your own stupidity on them. I attempted to conjure a few words to describe your prepubescent attitude, though i was unable to find any to describe such arrogance.

Greeny is a staff member who’s work is voluntary. He is not paid, rewarded or thanked for his role in this community. The only thing that i have ever seen him ask for is a little respect. You have failed to even show him that. You fail to contribute to this community and therefore fail to be a valuable asset. A community that allows for morons like you, is a community that is bound to fail. I don’t even see a reason for why you should be here.

Keyword of the post: Fail.

Read full topic

item.title: Renting out a Server Machine
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

[quote=“Greeny, post:17, topic:201811”]1) I’m English.
2) I know what the fuck a kilogram is
3) What the hell, does a kilogram have to do with computing?

Wait so your charging people based on the weight of the server?

If it’s a VPS presumably people only get a certain percentange of each machine, because a VPS is generally one server but broken down “virtually” into several so a few people can use it… yet you are charging each person the full whack of what the whole server costs.

Oh and the $ sign is still there. It clearly says 17$ KG. lulz.[/quote]

Well I just called it a VPS then… The person gets the entire server… Yes I am charging for the wieght of the server. Parts are heavy, and the heavier it is, the stronger the rack you need.

Read full topic
